DOC.brief_summary: This phase 3 , multicenter , randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial evaluate efficacy safety DX-2930 prevent acute angioedema attack patient Type I Type II HAE .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Study DX-2930 Prevent Acute Angioedema Attacks Patients With Type I Type II HAE
DOC.criteria: Males females 12 year age old time screen Documented diagnosis HAE , Type I II Baseline rate least 1 Investigatorconfirmed HAE attack per 4 week Adult subject caregiver subject age 18 willing able read , understand , sign inform consent form . Subjects age 12 17 , whose caregiver provide informed consent , willing able read , understand dsign assent form . Males femailes fertile sexually active must adhere contraception requirement . Concomitant diagnosis another form chronic , recurrent angioedema , acquire angioedema , idiopathic angioedema , recurrent angioedema associate urticaria . Participation prior DX2930 study Treatment investigational drug exposure investigational device within 4 week prior screen Exposure angiotensinconverting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitor estrogencontaining medication within 4 week prior screen . Exposure androgens within 2 week prior enter runin period . Use longterm prophylactic therapy HAE within 2 week prior enter runin period . Use shortterm prophylaxis HAE within 7 day prior enter runin period . Any following liver function test abnormality : alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) > 3x upper limit normal , aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) > 3x upper limit normal , total bilirubin > 2x upper limit normal ( unless bilirubin elevation result Gilbert 's syndrome ) . Pregnancy breastfeeding .
